Featured Image Zoom Button.description: The UI should display a featured image with a zoom button overlaid on top of it. When the zoom button is clicked, a larger version of the image should be displayed. The zoom button should be circular and have a zoom icon (+) in the center.

components.name: FeaturedImage
components.description: standalone, displays the featured image

components.name: ZoomButton
components.description: standalone, displays the zoom button

Featured Image Zoom Button.description: The UI should display a featured image with a zoom button overlay on top of it. The zoom button should be a circular icon with a zoom-in icon inside. When hovered, the zoom button should change its background color and cursor to indicate interactivity.

components.name: FeaturedImage
components.description: Standalone component that displays the featured image.

components.name: ZoomButton
components.description: Standalone component that displays the zoom button.

Team or colleagues section with photos a.description: The UI should display a team or colleagues section with a grid of members, each displaying a photo, name, and bio. The grid should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes. On mobile devices, the grid should display one member per row, and on larger devices, it should display multiple members per row.
Team or colleagues section with photos a.html: Our Team

components.name: TeamMemberCard
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single team member's photo, name, and bio.
components.html:
{name}

{bio}

Featured Video Controls Bar.description: The featured video controls bar should be a horizontal bar that appears below the featured video. It should have a play/pause button, a timer, and a volume control button. The bar should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes.

components.description: A standalone component that contains all video controls.

components.description: A standalone button that toggles the video playback state.

components.description: A standalone component that displays the video playback time.

components.description: A standalone button that controls the video volume.

Footer Social Media Icon.description: The UI should be a footer social media icon list that is responsive, mobile-first, accessible, SEO-friendly, and well-documented. It should consist of a horizontal list of social media icons (e.g. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.) with a hover effect to change the icon color.

components.name: SocialMediaIcon

Cookie Banners.description: A cookie banner is a notification that appears at the top or bottom of a webpage, informing users about the use of cookies on the website. It should be a non-obtrusive, dismissible notification that contains a message, an accept button, and an optional link to learn more.

components.name: CookieBanner
components.description: Standalone component that contains the cookie banner message, accept button, and optional link.
components.html:
{cookie_message}

{optional_link && ( {optional_link.text})}

components.name: CookieButton
components.description: Standalone component that represents the accept button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Accept</button>

Semantic HTML5 Markup.html: <html lang="en"><head><meta charset="UTF-8"/><meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"/><title>{title}</title></head><body class="min-h-screen flex flex-col"><HeaderComponent/><NavigationComponent/><main class="flex-1"><MainComponent><!-- child components will be rendered here --></MainComponent></main><FooterComponent/></body></html>

components.description: (standalone) - The bottommost section of the page, containing copyright information and other miscellaneous links.

Room Type and Rate Selection.description: The UI should display a list of room types with their corresponding rates and amenities. It should be responsive, with a single column layout on mobile devices and a two-column layout on larger screens. Responsive Post Formatting.description: The UI should display a responsive post format that adapts to different screen sizes, with a clear separation between the post's title, metadata, content, and action buttons. The post format should be mobile-first, accessible, and SEO-friendly.

components.description: (takes children): Wraps the entire post format.

Email filtering and sorting options.description: The UI should display a set of filtering and sorting options for an email inbox. There should be a dropdown for selecting filters (e.g. "Unread", "Starred", etc.), a dropdown for selecting sorting methods (e.g. "Oldest", "Newest", etc.), and a button to apply the selected filters and sorting.

components.name: FilterDropdown
components.description: (standalone): a dropdown component for selecting filters

components.name: SortDropdown
components.description: (standalone): a dropdown component for selecting sorting methods

components.name: ApplyButton
components.description: (standalone): a button to apply the selected filters and sorting
components.html: <button class="bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Apply</button>

components.name: FilterSortBar
components.description: (takes children): a container component to hold the filtering and sorting options

components.description: (standalone) - displays the customer's profile picture

components.name: ReviewInformation
components.description: (takes children) - contains the customer's name, rating, and review

components.name: Rating
components.description: (standalone) - displays the customer's rating using a 5-star system
components.html: {Array(5).fill(0).map((_, i) =>( ))}

components.description: (standalone) - displays the customer's brief review

components.html: <input type="file" id="file-upload" class="block w-full text-sm text-gray-700 file:mr-4 file:py-2 file:px-4 file:rounded-full file:border-0 file:text-sm file:font-semibold" accept="{accepted_file_types}" max-size="{max_file_size}"/>

components.description: standalone component

components.description: standalone component

Upload file input field with file type a.description: The UI should have a file input field that allows users to upload a file. The input field should have a label indicating the accepted file types and a maximum file size.
Upload file input field with file type a.html: Max file size: {maxFileSize}MB

components.name: FileInput
components.description: (standalone) - The file input field
components.html: <input type="file" class="block w-full text-sm text-gray-700 file:mr-4 file:py-2 file:px-4 file:border-0 file:text-sm file:font-semibold file:bg-blue-50 file:text-blue-700 hover:file:bg-blue-100" accept={acceptedFileTypes} maxLength={maxFileSize * 1024 * 1024}/>

components.name: Label
components.description: (takes children) - The label for the file input field

components.name: Description
components.description: (takes children) - The description of the file input field

Community Forum and Chat Tools.description: The UI should be a responsive community forum and chat tools page that allows users to discuss topics, ask questions, and interact with each other through a chat system. The page should be divided into two main sections: a forum section that displays a list of discussion topics, and a chat section that allows users to send messages to each other.
Community Forum and Chat Tools.html:
Community Forum

Chat

components.name: ForumTopicList
components.description: A component that takes children (a list of **ForumTopicCard** components) and displays them in a scrollable list.

components.name: ChatInput
components.description: A standalone component that allows users to input and send messages.
components.html: <form class="flex mb-4"><input type="text" class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-gray-700" placeholder="Type a message..."><button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Send</button></form>

components.name: ChatMessage
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single chat message, including the sender's username and message text.
components.html:
{username}

{messageText}

components.name: ChatMessageList
components.description: A component that takes children (a list of **ChatMessage** components) and displays them in a scrollable list.

Coupon/Discount Codes.description: A clean and simple coupon/discount code input field with a submit button. The input field should be accompanied by a label and a description. The submit button should be prominent and accessible.

components.name: CouponCodeInput
components.description: Standalone component that renders a single input field for the coupon/discount code.
components.html: <input type="text" id="coupon-code" class="block w-full pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700"/>

components.name: SubmitButton
components.description: Standalone component that renders a submit button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Apply Code</button>

components.name: CouponCodeLabel
components.description: Standalone component that renders a label for the input field.
components.html: <label for="coupon-code" class="block text-sm font-bold mb-2">Enter your coupon code:</label>

components.name: DescriptionText
components.description: Standalone component that renders a small text description.
components.html: Enter a valid coupon code to receive your discount.

Thread/List View of Topics.description: The UI should be a scrollable list of topics, with each topic displaying its title, description, and some metadata (e.g., author, date created). The list should be ordered by most recent topic first. On smaller screens, the list should be single-column, and on larger screens, it should be a multi-column layout.
Thread/List View of Topics.html: Topics

components.description: (takes children): a container component that renders a list of `TopicCard` components.

components.name: PostEmbed
components.description: takes children to wrap the entire post embed.

Social Media Feed Footer.description: The Social Media Feed Footer should be a responsive footer section that displays social media links and a copyright notice. On larger screens, the social media links should be aligned to the right, while on smaller screens, they should stack vertically.

components.name: SocialMediaLink
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single social media link.

components.name: CopyrightNotice
components.description: A standalone component that displays a copyright notice.

components.name: SocialMediaFeedFooter
components.description: A component that takes children and displays the social media links and copyright notice.

Social Media Feed Footer.description: The social media feed footer should be a responsive, mobile-first footer that displays social media links, a copyright notice, and an optional newsletter signup form. On mobile, the links and copyright notice should be stacked vertically, while on larger screens, they should be arranged horizontally.

components.name: SocialMediaLink
components.description: standalone component that takes a social media platform name and URL as props.
components.html: {platformName}

components.name: CopyrightNotice
components.description: standalone component that takes a copyright year and owner as props.

components.name: NewsletterSignup
components.description: standalone component that takes a form action URL and optional label text as props.
components.html: <form action="{formActionUrl}" method="post"><label for="email" class="sr-only">Email address</label><input type="email" id="email" name="email" placeholder="Enter your email address" class="w-full lg:w-auto"><button type="submit" class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Subscribe</button></form>

components.name: SocialMediaFeedFooter
components.description: container component that takes children (e.g., `SocialMediaLink`, `CopyrightNotice`, and `NewsletterSignup`).

Post Card: A single post with user info.description: The UI should be a card that displays a single post with user information and actions. It should be responsive, mobile-first, accessible, and SEO-friendly. The card should have a clear hierarchy of information, with the user's profile picture, name, and timestamp at the top, followed by the post content, and then the actions (e.g., like, comment, share) at the bottom.

{timestamp}

components.description: (standalone): Displays the actions (e.g., like, comment, share) for the post.

components.name: PostCard
components.description: (takes children): The container component that wraps around the user profile, post content, and post actions.

Real-time Comment and Discussion Forum.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first comment and discussion forum that displays a list of comments and allows users to post new comments. The forum should have a clean and simple design, with clear typography and sufficient whitespace to improve readability.

components.name: CommentItem
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single comment.
components.html:
{username}

{comment_text}

components.name: CommentForm
components.description: A standalone component that allows users to post a new comment.
components.html: <form class="flex flex-col gap-2"><input type="text" placeholder="Write a comment..." class="w-full p-2"/><button class="bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Post Comment </button></form>

components.name: CommentList
components.description: A component that takes children (multiple `CommentItem` components) and displays them in a list.

components.name: ForumHeader
components.description: A standalone component that displays the title of the forum.

components.name: ForumContainer
components.description: A component that takes children (multiple components) and wraps them in a container with a max-width for responsive design.

The UI should be easy to read and understand, with sufficient whitespace to avoid clutter.

components.description: A standalone component that displays the background image and gradient overlay.

components.name: HeroGradientOverlay
components.description: A standalone component that displays the gradient overlay with animation effect.

Social media links with icons and toolti.description: The UI should display a row of social media links with their respective icons and tooltips when hovered.

components.name: SocialMediaLink
components.description: A standalone component that represents a single social media link with an icon and tooltip.
components.html: {social_media_name}{social_media_name}

components.html: {social_media_name}{social_media_name}

Responsive Article Layout.description: The UI should display a responsive article layout with a header, image, and content sections. The layout should be mobile-first, accessible, and SEO-friendly.

components.name: ArticleHeader
components.description: Standalone component that displays the article title and metadata.
components.html:
{article_title}

{author_name} - {published_date}

components.name: ArticleImage
components.description: Standalone component that displays the article image.

components.name: ArticleContent
components.description: Component that takes children, which represents the article content.

Editable Tables.description: A table that can be edited, with input fields for each cell, and a "Save" button at the bottom.

components.description: (takes children): a single table cell with an input field

components.description: (takes children): the entire editable table with multiple rows

Video Players/Embeds.description: The UI should display a responsive video player/embed that adapts to different screen sizes. The video player should have a maximum width and be centered horizontally on the page. The video title and video description should be displayed below the video player.

components.name: VideoPlayer
components.description: A standalone component that wraps the video player/embed.

components.name: VideoTitle
components.description: A standalone component that displays the video title.

components.name: VideoDescription
components.description: A standalone component that displays the video description.

Direct message conversation list with on.description: The UI should be a list of direct message conversations, each displaying the conversation title, the last message, and the online status of the other user. The list should be responsive, with a maximum width and scrollable on smaller screens.

components.name: ConversationItem
components.description: (standalone): Represents a single conversation item in the list.
components.html:
• {conversation_title}

    {last_message_preview}

components.name: OnlineStatusIndicator
components.description: (standalone): Indicates whether the other user is online or offline.

Character counter for tweet length.description: A simple text input with a character count display below it, indicating the number of characters remaining for a tweet (out of 280 characters).

components.name: TextAreaInput
components.description: a standalone component for the text input field
components.html: <textarea class="w-full p-2 text-lg" placeholder="What's on your mind?"/>

components.name: CharacterCountDisplay
components.description: a standalone component for displaying the character count

Character counter for tweet length.description: A simple text input with a character count display below it, indicating the number of characters remaining for a tweet (out of 280 characters).

components.name: TextAreaInput
components.description: a standalone component for the text input field
components.html: <textarea class="w-full p-2 text-lg" placeholder="What's on your mind?"/>

components.name: CharacterCountDisplay
components.description: a standalone component for displaying the character count

Character counter for tweet length.description: The UI should be a text input field with a character counter that displays the remaining characters available for a tweet. The counter should turn red when the character limit is exceeded.

components.name: TweetInput
components.description: A standalone component that represents the text input field.
components.html: <input type="text" class="w-full p-2 border border-gray-200 rounded"/>

components.name: CharacterCounter
components.description: A standalone component that displays the remaining characters available for a tweet.

Character counter for tweet length.description: A simple text input with a character count display below it, indicating the number of characters remaining for a tweet (out of 280 characters).

components.name: TextAreaInput
components.description: a standalone component for the text input field
components.html: <textarea class="w-full p-2 text-lg" placeholder="What's on your mind?"/>

components.name: CharacterCountDisplay
components.description: a standalone component for displaying the character count

Character counter for tweet length.description: The UI should display a text input field where the user can type their tweet. Below the input field, a counter should display the number of characters remaining, indicating how many more characters the user can type before reaching the tweet limit (280 characters).

components.name: TweetInput
components.description: a standalone component that takes a text input.
components.html: <input type="text" class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700" placeholder="Type your tweet..."/>

components.name: CharacterCounter
components.description: a standalone component that displays the remaining character count.

Skeleton Screens/Loading.description: A loading UI with a loading animation and a set of skeleton screens for a list of items. The loading animation is a simple rotating wheel and the skeleton screens display a set of rectangles with a slight animation.

components.name: LoadingIndicator
components.description: a standalone component that displays a rotating wheel

components.name: SkeletonScreen
components.description: a standalone component that displays a rectangle that animates to simulate loading

components.name: SkeletonList
components.description: a component that takes children, which are a set of `SkeletonScreen` components

Navigation Menu Toggle.description: The UI should be a responsive navigation menu toggle button that can be used to expand or collapse a navigation menu. On mobile devices, it should be a hamburger icon, and on larger screens, it should be a text label indicating whether the menu is open or closed.

components.name: NavigationToggle
components.description: Standalone component that renders a toggle button for the navigation menu.

components.name: NavigationMenu
components.description: Component that takes children, renders the navigation menu and handles the toggle state.

Blog Post Comment Count.description: The UI should display the number of comments on a blog post, with a responsive design that adapts to different screen sizes. The comment count should be displayed in a subtle, yet readable font size, with sufficient padding to make it easily readable on both light and dark backgrounds.

components.name: CommentCount
components.description: A standalone component that displays the number of comments on a blog post.

Company Address Map.description: The UI should display a map with a marker indicating the company's address. The map should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes. Below the map, the company's address should be displayed in a readable format.

components.name: CompanyAddressMap
components.description: A standalone component that displays a map with a marker indicating the company's address.

components.name: AddressDisplay
components.description: A component that takes children to display the company's address in a readable format.

Company Address Map.description: The UI should display a map with a pin indicating the company's location, along with the company's address and contact information.

components.name: CompanyAddressMap
components.description: a standalone component that displays the map and company information.

components.description: a standalone component that displays the pin on the map.

Company Address Map.description: The UI should display a company address along with a map to help users locate the company. The address should be clearly visible, and the map should be interactive, allowing users to zoom in and out.

components.description: (standalone): Displays the company address.

components.name: Map
components.description: (standalone): Displays an interactive map.

components.description: (takes children): A container component that holds the company address and map components.

{children}
{children}

Hero Section with Text.description: The UI should be a hero section with a background image and a section of text overlay on top of it. The background image should be full-width and take up the entire screen height on desktop. On mobile, the image should be smaller and the text should be more prominent.
Hero Section with Text.html: <section class="h-screen w-full relative"><HeroSection/><HeroText><!-- hero text content goes here --></HeroText></section>

components.name: HeroSection
components.description: (standalone) - the main hero section component
components.html: <div class="h-screen w-full absolute top-0 left-0 bg-cover bg-center" style={{ backgroundImage: `url(${hero_image_url})` }}/>

components.description: (takes children) - the text overlay component

Alert Close Button Style.description: The UI should be a small, clickable button that allows users to close an alert message. The button should be a small "X" or "Close" text, and should be styled to stand out from the rest of the alert message.

components.name: AlertCloseButton
components.description: a standalone component that renders a small clickable button to close an alert message.

Testimonial Slider: Showcase social proo.description: The Testimonial Slider should display quotes from happy customers with their names and photos, enclosed in a container that can be navigated using previous and next buttons. The slider should be responsive, adapting to different screen sizes and devices.

components.name: TestimonialSlider
components.description: A container component that wraps the entire slider, including navigation buttons and testimonial items. (Takes children: TestimonialItem)

components.name: TestimonialItem
components.description: A single testimonial item that displays a customer's quote, name, and photo. (Standalone)
components.html:
{quote}

{customer_name}

components.name: SliderNavigation
components.description: A component that contains previous and next buttons for navigating the slider. (Standalone)

Product Price Discount.description: The UI should display the original price of a product, a discounted price, and a discount percentage. The discounted price should be prominent, and the original price should be struck through. The discount percentage should be displayed clearly.

components.description: (standalone): A container component that holds the product price discount information.

components.name: OriginalPrice
components.description: (standalone): A component that displays the original price of the product.

components.name: DiscountPrice
components.description: (standalone): A component that displays the discounted price of the product.

components.name: DiscountPercentage
components.description: (standalone): A component that displays the discount percentage.

Profile Picture and Header Image.description: The UI should have a profile picture and a header image that takes up the full width of the screen. On mobile, the profile picture should be circular and centered, with the header image below it. On larger screens, the profile picture should be circular and aligned to the left, with the header image taking up the rest of the width.

components.description: (standalone): A header image that takes up the full width of the screen.

The UI should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible.

Dependancy Graph Visualization Component.description: The Dependency Graph Visualization Component should display a graph showing the relationships between different dependencies. The graph should be responsive, accessible, and mobile-friendly. The nodes in the graph should be clickable, and when clicked, the node should be highlighted and the related dependencies should be visually emphasized.

components.name: DependencyGraphComponent
components.description: (takes children) - contains the graph and handles node relationships

components.name: TooltipComponent
components.description: (takes children) - displays additional information when a node is hovered or clicked

Price and Discount Badges.description: The UI should display a price badge with an optional discount badge next to it. The price badge should show the original price, and the discount badge should show the discount percentage and the new price.

components.name: PriceBadge
components.description: A standalone component that displays the original price.

components.name: DiscountBadge
components.description: A standalone component that displays the discount percentage and the new price.
components.html: {discount_percentage}% OFF {new_price}

Price and Discount Badges.description: The UI should display two badges, one for price and one for discount, with different background colors and text colors. The price badge should have a light blue background and white text, and the discount badge should have a green background and white text.

components.name: PriceBadge
components.description: Standalone component, displays the price of an item.

components.name: DiscountBadge
components.description: Standalone component, displays the discount of an item.
components.html: {discount}% off

Price and Discount Badges.description: The UI should display two types of badges: a price badge and a discount badge. The price badge shows the original price, and the discount badge shows the discount percentage. The badges should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible.

components.name: PriceBadge
components.description: a standalone component that displays the original price.

components.name: DiscountBadge
components.description: a standalone component that displays the discount percentage.
components.html: {discount_percentage}% Off

components.html: {notification_count}

components.name: NotificationAlert
components.description: (standalone) - a small notification message with an icon and text
components.html: {notification_message}

The profile picture should be circular and surrounded by a subtle border. Code Review and Approval Workflow.description: The UI should display a vertical timeline of code review and approval workflow, with each step represented by a circular icon and a brief description. The timeline should be responsive and adaptable to different screen sizes.

components.html:
{step_icon}

{step_description}

{step_status}

components.name: RevealContent
components.description: standalone component that displays the revealed content (heading and background).
components.html: {heading_text}

Game Tiles and Grids.description: The UI should display a grid of game tiles. Each tile should have a unique background color, a number indicating the tile's value, and an optional "locked" indicator.

{locked && (Locked)} {children}

Avatar Upload: Input field for uploading.description: The UI should be a simple input field with a label that allows users to upload a profile picture. The input field should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes.

components.name: InputLabel
components.description: (standalone) - The label for the input field.
components.html: <label for="avatar-upload" class="block mb-2 text-sm font-bold text-gray-700">Upload Profile Picture</label>

components.description: (standalone) - The input field for uploading the profile picture.
components.html: <input type="file" id="avatar-upload" class="block w-full px-4 py-2 text-gray-700"/>

Message input field with send button and.description: A message input field with a send button on the right side, and an emoji picker button on the left side of the input field.

components.name: EmojiPickerButton
components.description: standalone component that renders an emoji picker
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded"></button>

components.name: SendButton
components.description: standalone component that renders a send button

components.name: MessageInputField
components.description: component that takes children

Message input field with send button and.description: The UI should be a message input field with a send button and an emoji picker. The input field should be responsive and mobile-friendly. The send button should be enabled only when the input field has some text. The emoji picker should be a dropdown list that appears when the user clicks on the emoji icon. The UI should be accessible, with clear labels and high contrast colors.

components.name: MessageInputField
components.description: standalone component that renders an input field.
components.html: <input type="text" class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700" placeholder="Type a message..."/>

components.name: SendButton
components.description: standalone component that renders a button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded" disabled={isDisabled}>Send</button>

    • ))}

components.description: takes children, renders a button that toggles the emoji picker dropdown.

Channel topic and description with edit.description: A channel topic and description with an edit button. The topic should be a heading, the description should be a paragraph, and the edit button should be a small button with a pencil icon. The UI should be responsive, with the edit button aligned to the right on larger screens, and below the description on smaller screens.

components.description: Standalone component that displays a heading with the channel topic.

components.name: ChannelDescription
components.description: Standalone component that displays a paragraph with the channel description.

components.name: EditButton
components.description: Standalone component that displays a small button with a pencil icon.

Channel topic and description with edit.description: The UI should display a channel topic and description with an edit button. The edit button should be aligned to the right side of the container. On smaller screens, the edit button should be aligned below the channel topic.

Interactive Product Demo Simulation.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first, interactive demo simulation that allows users to explore a product's features and benefits. It should have a clean and modern design, with clear typography and prominent calls-to-action.
Interactive Product Demo Simulation.html:
Insert feature content here...
Insert feature content here...
Insert feature content here...

components.name: ProductHero
components.description: A standalone component that serves as the hero section of the demo simulation, featuring a prominent product image and a brief introduction.
components.html:
{hero_title}

{hero_subtitle}

components.name: FeatureCard
components.description: A component that takes children, used to showcase individual features of the product, including a brief description and a call-to-action.

components.name: CallToAction
components.description: A standalone component that encourages users to take a specific action, such as "Learn More" or "Get Started".
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">{cta_text}</button>

components.name: ProductImage
components.description: A standalone component that displays a product image.

Features Grid: Highlight key benefits in.description: A responsive grid layout with 3-4 columns, showcasing key benefits of a product or service. Each grid item should have an icon, a heading, and a brief description.
Features Grid: Highlight key benefits in.html: <section class="container mx-auto p-4 lg:p-8"><FeaturesGrid><FeatureItem/><FeatureItem/><FeatureItem/><!-- Add more FeatureItem components as needed --></FeaturesGrid></section>

components.name: FeatureItem
components.description: (standalone): A single feature item in the grid, containing an icon, heading, and description.
components.html:
{heading}

{description}

components.name: FeaturesGrid
components.description: (takes children): The container element for the feature items, managing the grid layout.

Loading spinner with animation and progr.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first loading spinner with an animation and a progress circle. The progress circle should show the percentage of completion.

components.name: LoadingSpinner
components.description: a standalone component that displays the loading animation and progress circle.
components.html: {progress}%

Product Description Textarea.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first, and accessible textarea component for entering product descriptions. It should have a clear and concise design, with a clear label and sufficient space for user input.

components.name: ProductDescriptionTextarea
components.description: A standalone component representing the textarea for entering product descriptions.
components.html: <textarea id="product-description" class="block w-full p-2 pl-10 text-lg text-gray-700 bg-gray-50 rounded" placeholder="Enter product description..."/>

Form Validation Feedback.description: The UI should display form validation feedback in a clear and accessible manner. It should provide users with information about the errors in their form submission, with clear and concise error messages.

components.name: ValidationError
components.description: component (standalone) - displays a single error message

Tag Cloud

User Comments and Feedback.description: The UI should display a list of user comments and feedback, with each comment showing the user's name, profile picture, comment text, and a timestamp. The UI should also include a form for users to submit new comments.

components.name: CommentCard
components.description: (Standalone): Displays a single comment, including the user's name, profile picture, comment text, and timestamp.

components.name: CommentForm
components.description: (Standalone): Provides a form for users to submit new comments.
components.html: <form class="flex mb-4"><input type="text" placeholder="Enter your comment..." class="w-full p-2"/><button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Submit</button></form>

components.name: CommentList
components.description: (Takes Children): Displays a list of `CommentCard` components.

components.name: UserProfilePicture
components.description: (Standalone): Displays a user's profile picture.

Product Showcase with Animated Cards.description: The UI should be a product showcase with a grid of animated cards. Each card should have a hover effect and display a product image, title, and description. The grid should be responsive and adjust to different screen sizes.

components.name: ProductCard
components.description: (standalone): A single product card with a hover effect.
components.html:
{product_name}

{product_description}

components.name: ProductGrid
components.description: (takes children): A grid container that wraps multiple `ProductCard` components.

Product filtering and sorting controls.description: The UI should display a set of filtering and sorting controls for products, allowing users to narrow down their search results by category, price range, and rating. The controls should be responsive, accessible, and easy to use on various devices.

components.name: FilterCategorySelect
components.description: A standalone dropdown component for selecting a product category.
components.html: <select class="bg-white border border-gray-300 rounded-full text-gray-600 py-2 px-4 w-full"><option value="">{category_placeholder}</option><!-- Option list will be populated dynamically --></select>

components.name: PriceRangeSlider
components.description: A standalone component for selecting a price range.
components.html: Min: {min_price}Max: {max_price}

components.name: RatingFilterButtons
components.description: A standalone component for selecting a rating filter.

components.name: SortBySelect
components.description: A standalone dropdown component for selecting a sorting option.
components.html: <select class="bg-white border border-gray-300 rounded-full text-gray-600 py-2 px-4 w-full"><option value="">Sort by</option><option value="price_asc">Price: Low to High</option><option value="price_desc">Price: High to Low</option><option value="rating_desc">Rating: High to Low</option></select>

components.name: FilterControls
components.description: A container component that takes children ( FilterCategorySelect, PriceRangeSlider, RatingFilterButtons, and SortBySelect ).

Individual email thread with reply butto.description: The UI should display an individual email thread with reply buttons. The email thread should show the sender's name, email subject, and email body. There should be reply buttons (e.g., "Reply" and "Reply All") below the email body.

components.name: EmailThread
components.description: Standalone component that displays an individual email thread.

components.name: EmailMetadata
components.description: Standalone component that displays the sender's name and email subject.

components.name: EmailBody
components.description: Standalone component that displays the email body.

components.name: ReplyButtons
components.description: Standalone component that displays the reply buttons.

Individual email thread with reply butto.description: The UI should display an individual email thread with reply buttons. The email thread should show the sender's name, email subject, and email body. There should be reply buttons (e.g., "Reply" and "Reply All") below the email body.

components.name: EmailThread

Custom Field Builder: Create tailored da.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first, and accessible interface for building custom data fields. It should consist of a header, a field-type selection section, and a field configuration section. The header should display the title "Custom Field Builder" and have an optional "Save" button. The field-type selection section should display a list of available field types (e.g., text, number, date, etc.). The field configuration section should display fields depending on the selected field type.

components.name: HeaderComponent
components.description: (standalone): Displays the title and optional save button.
components.html: Custom Field Builder

components.name: FieldTypeSelectorComponent
components.description: (standalone): Displays a list of available field types.

components.name: FieldConfiguratorComponent
components.description: (takes children): Displays fields depending on the selected field type.
components.html: <!-- field configuration fields will be rendered here based on the selected field type -->{children}

The design should be responsive, accessible, and visually appealing, with clear typography and sufficient whitespace.
Tweet display for individual posts.html: <article class="max-w-md mx-auto pb-4 mb-4 bg-white rounded-md shadow-md"><TweetHeader/><TweetTimestamp/><TweetText/><TweetMedia><!-- Optional media content --></TweetMedia><TweetFooter/></article>

{name}

components.description: Standalone component displaying the timestamp of the tweet.

components.description: Standalone component displaying the text of the tweet.

components.description: Component that takes children to display optional media (e.g., images or videos).

Call-to-Action (CTA) Button Section.description: The UI should have a prominent call-to-action (CTA) button section with a bold headline, a brief description, and a prominent CTA button that encourages the user to take action.

components.name: HeadlineComponent
components.description: Standalone component that displays a bold headline text.

components.name: DescriptionComponent
components.description: Standalone component that displays a brief descriptive text.

components.name: CTAButtonComponent
components.description: Standalone component that displays a prominent CTA button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">{cta_button_text}</button>

Call-to-Action (CTA) Button Section.description: The UI should be a prominent call-to-action (CTA) button section that encourages users to take a specific action. The section should be full-width, with a bold background color, and a contrasting CTA button that stands out. The section should be responsive, with the button size and spacing adjusting based on screen size.

components.name: CTASection
components.description: - standalone component that contains the entire CTA section
components.html:
{headline}

{description}

components.name: CTAButton
components.description: - standalone component that represents the call-to-action button
components.html: <button class="bg-white hover:bg-gray-200 text-orange-500 font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">{button_text}</button>

Search bar for finding products.description: The UI should be a simple search bar with a text input field and a submit button. The search bar should be responsive, taking up the full width on mobile devices and a maximum width of 400px on desktop devices. The input field should have a placeholder text "Search for products...". The submit button should have a search icon and the text "Search".

components.name: SearchBar
components.description: a standalone component that contains the input field and submit button.

components.name: SearchButton
components.description: a standalone component that contains the search icon and text.

Product Rating Average.description: The UI should display the average rating of a product, with a maximum rating of 5 stars. The rating should be displayed visually using 5 stars, with filled stars representing the average rating and unfilled stars representing the remaining rating. The average rating should be displayed as a numerical value next to the stars.

components.name: RatingStars
components.description: (standalone): Displays the 5 stars, with some filled and some unfilled to represent the average rating.
components.html: {filledStarCount}{unfilledStarCount}

components.name: AverageRatingText
components.description: (standalone): Displays the numerical average rating next to the stars.

The average rating should be displayed as a numerical value next to the stars.

components.name: RatingStars
components.description: (standalone): Displays the 5 stars, with some filled and some unfilled to represent the average rating.
components.html: {filledStarCount}{unfilledStarCount}

components.name: AverageRatingText
components.description: (standalone): Displays the numerical average rating next to the stars.

Header: Site title and navigation links.description: The UI should be a header section at the top of the webpage, featuring a site title on the left side and navigation links on the right side. The site title should be prominent and centered on mobile devices, while the navigation links should be stacked on top of each other on mobile devices and aligned horizontally on larger screens.
Header: Site title and navigation links.html: <header><Header><SiteTitle/><NavLinks><NavLink/><NavLink/><!-- Add more NavLink components as needed --></NavLinks></Header></header>

components.description: (standalone): displays a single navigation link

components.name: NavLinks
components.description: (takes children): a container for multiple `NavLink` components

components.name: Header
components.description: (takes children): the top-level component that contains the site title and navigation links

Video upload tool with encoding options.description: The UI should be a video upload tool with encoding options. It should have a file input field, a dropdown menu for selecting the encoding preset, a checkbox for enabling watermarks, and a submit button. The UI should be responsive, accessible, and SEO-friendly.

components.description: A standalone component for the file input field.

components.name: EncodingPresetSelect
components.description: A standalone component for the dropdown menu for selecting the encoding preset.

components.name: WatermarkCheckbox
components.description: A standalone component for the checkbox for enabling watermarks.

components.name: SubmitButton
components.description: A standalone component for the submit button.
components.html: <button class="bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Upload Video</button>

components.name: VideoUploadForm

components.description: A standalone component that provides a visual cue for audio feedback. It will display a waveform or a similar visual representation of the audio input.

Search Bar.description: The UI should be a simple search bar with a input field and a submit button. It should be responsive and mobile-friendly.

Search Bar.description: The UI should be a simple search bar with a input field and a button to submit the search query. The search bar should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes.

components.name: SearchBar
components.description: standalone component that contains the input field and search button.

components.name: SearchInput
components.description: standalone component that represents the input field.
components.html: <input type="search" id="search" class="bg-gray-50 border border-gray-300 text-gray-900 text-sm rounded-lg focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-blue-500 block w-full p-2.5" placeholder="Search...">

components.name: SearchButton
components.description: standalone component that represents the search button.
components.html: <button type="submit" class="text-white bg-blue-700 hover:bg-blue-800 focus:ring-4 focus:outline-none focus:ring-blue-300 font-medium rounded-lg text-sm px-5 py-2.5">Search</button>

Sticky Header/Footer.description: The UI should have a sticky header at the top of the page, a main content area in the middle, and a sticky footer at the bottom of the page. The header and footer should remain fixed at the top and bottom of the page, respectively, even when the user scrolls.
